  "description": "Buymore Supermarket is&nbsp;a retail/supermarket with four branches (GRA Ikeja, Abule Egba, Isheri, &amp; Ibafo).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Financial Controller
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Head of Finance is responsible for overseeing the financial operations of the supermarket chain, ensuring strong financial controls, accurate reporting, compliance with statutory requirements, and effective budgeting to support business growth.
	The role provides strategic financial leadership and ensures efficient financial management across all four branches.


Responsibilities
Financial Planning &amp; Strategy:


	Develop and implement the company&rsquo;s annual budget and financial strategy.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial forecasts to guide business decisions.
	Lead financial analysis to support expansion, pricing decisions, and profitability.


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare timely and accurate financial reports:
	Profit &amp; Loss statement
	Balance sheets
	Cash flow statements
	Branch performance reports
	Present financial performance insights to management and recommend improvements.


Financial Controls &amp; Compliance


	Establish and enforce robust internal controls across all branches (cash handling, POS reconciliation, stock movement, and approvals).
	Ensure compliance with tax laws, regulatory requirements, and IFRS/GAAP standards.
	Manage external audits and ensure proper documentation.


Cashflow &amp; Treasury Management:


	Monitor daily cashflow and ensure adequate liquidity for operations.
	Oversee bank reconciliations, vendor payments, and receivables management.
	Ensure proper management of POS settlements, transfers, and revenue reconciliation.


Inventory &amp; Cost Management:


	Oversee inventory valuation, stock audits, and shrinkage control.
	Work with Procurement and Operations to manage cost of sales and maintain healthy margins.
	Analyse branch variances, wastages, and price discrepancies.


Team Leadership &amp; Branch Oversight:


	Supervise branch accountants, cashiers, and finance staff.
	Conduct finance-related training across branches (cash handling, documentation, reporting).
	Implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) for branch financial activities.


Systems &amp; Process Improvement:


	Work with IT and operations to enhance the use of accounting software and POS systems.
	Automate reporting and streamline financial processes for efficiency.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field.
	Minimum of 7&ndash;10 years relevant experience, with at least 3 years in a senior finance role.
	Professional certification: ICAN or ACCA required.
	Strong experience in retail, supermarket, FMCG, or multi-branch operations.
	Deep understanding of accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, ERP), POS systems, and stock management processes.


Skill &amp; Competencies:


	Strong analytical and numerical skills.
	Excellent leadership and team management ability.
	High attention to detail and strong internal control mindset.
	Strong communication and presentation skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced retail environment.
	Problem-solving skills and sound financial judgement.


Method of Application&nbsp;

	Establish and enforce robust internal controls across all branches (cash handling, POS reconciliation, stock movement, and approvals).

{

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Administration Officer",
  "description": "Turaren Wuta By Ray Limited, a captivating brand hailing from Nigeria, weaves a story that goes beyond mere fragrances; it&#39;s a narrative of passion, craftsmanship, and a mission to create sensory experiences that linger in the hearts and spaces of our cherished customers. Our journey begins with a vision - a vision to transcend the ordinary and introduce unique scents to the world. Turarenwuta, meaning &quot;incense&quot; in Hausa, reflects our commitment to the artistry of aromas. Founded by Rahanatu Ahmad, a visionary with a deep appreciation for the impact scents can have on our lives, the brand emerged with the goal of elevating the olfactory experience for individuals and their surroundings.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Administration Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Katsina
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting Line: Reports to: Operations Manager / Store Manager / Supply Chain Lead

Job Purpose


	The Inventory Administration Officer is responsible for maintaining accurate inventory records, monitoring stock movements, supporting inventory control processes, and ensuring the availability of materials and products while minimizing losses, discrepancies, and stockouts.


Key Duties and Responsibilities
Inventory Control &amp; Records:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date inventory records for all stock items.
	Record all inventory transactions including receipts, issues, transfers, and returns using approved inventory systems or registers.
	Conduct regular physical stock counts and reconciliations against system records.
	Investigate and report inventory variances, losses, or damages promptly.


Stock Monitoring &amp; Reporting:


	Monitor stock levels and flag low stock or overstock situations to management.
	Prepare periodic inventory reports (daily, weekly, monthly) for management review.
	Track fast-moving, slow-moving, and obsolete items and recommend corrective actions.
	Support reorder planning by providing accurate stock data and consumption trends.


Warehouse &amp; Store Coordination:


	Ensure proper storage, labeling, and organization of inventory in line with company procedures.
	Work closely with storekeepers, warehouse staff, and production teams to ensure smooth stock flow.
	Ensure all inventory movements are properly authorized and documented.


Compliance &amp; Controls:


	Enforce inventory control policies, procedures, and internal controls.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and security standards within storage areas.
	Support audits by providing inventory records and participating in stock verification exercises.


Administrative Support:


	Maintain inventory documentation including delivery notes, issue vouchers, bin cards, and stock registers.
	File and archive inventory records accurately for audit and reference purposes.

Job Purpose


	The Inventory Administration Officer is responsible for maintaining accurate inventory records, monitoring stock movements, supporting inventory control processes, and ensuring the availability of materials and products while minimizing losses, discrepancies, and stockouts.


Key Duties and Responsibilities
Inventory Control & Records:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date inventory records for all stock items.

Stock Monitoring & Reporting:


	Monitor stock levels and flag low stock or overstock situations to management.
	Prepare periodic inventory reports (daily, weekly, monthly) for management review.
	Track fast-moving, slow-moving, and obsolete items and recommend corrective actions.
	Support reorder planning by providing accurate stock data and consumption trends.


Warehouse & Store Coordination:


	Ensure proper storage, labeling, and organization of inventory in line with company procedures.

	Support audits by providing inventory records and participating in stock verification exercises.


Administrative Support:
